   19: %%
   20: 
   21: %%
   22: %% Tests based on the contents of the diameter app file.
   23: %%
   24: 
   25: -module(diameter_app_SUITE).
   26: 
   27: %% testcases, no common_test dependency
   28: -export([run/0,
   29:          run/1]).
   30: 
   31: %% common_test wrapping
   32: -export([suite/0,
   33:          all/0]).
   34: 
   35: %% testcases
   36: -export([keys/1,
   37:          vsn/1,
   38:          modules/1,
   39:          exports/1,
   40:          release/1,
   41:          xref/1,
   42:          relup/1]).
   43: 
   44: -include_lib("kernel/include/file.hrl").
   45: 
   46: -define(util, diameter_util).
   47: -define(A, list_to_atom).
   48: 
   49: %% Modules not in the app and that should not have dependencies on it
   50: %% for build reasons.
   51: -define(COMPILER_MODULES, [diameter_codegen,
   52:                            diameter_dict_scanner,
   53:                            diameter_dict_parser,
   54:                            diameter_dict_util,
   55:                            diameter_exprecs,
   56:                            diameter_make]).
   57: 
   58: -define(INFO_MODULES, [diameter_dbg,
   59:                        diameter_info]).
   60: 
   61: %% ===========================================================================
   62: 
   63: suite() ->
   64:     [{timetrap, {seconds, 20}}].
   65: 
   66: all() ->
   67:     [keys,
   68:      vsn,
   69:      modules,
   70:      exports,
   71:      release,
   72:      xref,
   73:      relup].
   74: 
   75: %% ===========================================================================
   76: 
   77: run() ->
   78:     run(all()).
   79: 
   80: run(List) ->
   81:     Tmp = ?util:mktemp("diameter_app"),
   82:     try
   83:         run([{priv_dir, Tmp}], List)
   84:     after
   85:         file:del_dir_r(Tmp)
   86:     end.
   87: 
   88: run(Config, List) ->
   89:     [{application, diameter, App}] = ?util:consult(diameter, app),
   90:     ?util:run([{{?MODULE, F, [{App, Config}]}, 10000} || F <- List]).
   91: 
   92: %% ===========================================================================
   93: %% # keys/1
   94: %%
   95: %% Ensure that the app file contains selected keys. Some of these would
   96: %% also be caught by other testcases.
   97: %% ===========================================================================
   98: 
   99: keys({App, _Config}) ->
  100:     [] = lists:filter(fun(K) -> not lists:keymember(K, 1, App) end,
  101:                       [vsn, description, modules, registered, applications]);
  102: 
  103: keys(Config) ->
  104:     run(Config, [keys]).
  105: 
  106: %% ===========================================================================
  107: %% # vsn/1
  108: %%
  109: %% Ensure that our app version sticks to convention.
  110: %% ===========================================================================
  111: 
  112: vsn({App, _Config}) ->
  113:     true = is_vsn(fetch(vsn, App));
  114: 
  115: vsn(Config) ->
  116:     run(Config, [vsn]).
  117: 
  118: %% ===========================================================================
  119: %% # modules/1
  120: %%
  121: %% Ensure that the app file modules and installed modules differ by
  122: %% compiler/info modules.
  123: %% ===========================================================================
  124: 
  125: modules({App, _Config}) ->
  126:     Mods = fetch(modules, App),
  127:     Installed = code_mods(),
  128:     Help = lists:sort(?INFO_MODULES ++ ?COMPILER_MODULES),
  129:     {[], Help} = {Mods -- Installed, lists:sort(Installed -- Mods)};
  130: 
  131: modules(Config) ->
  132:     run(Config, [modules]).
  133: 
  134: code_mods() ->
  135:     Dir  = code:lib_dir(diameter, ebin),
  136:     {ok, Files} = file:list_dir(Dir),
  137:     [?A(lists:reverse(R)) || N <- Files, "maeb." ++ R <- [lists:reverse(N)]].
  138: 
  139: %% ===========================================================================
  140: %% # exports/1
  141: %%
  142: %% Ensure that no module does export_all.
  143: %% ===========================================================================
  144: 
  145: exports({App, _Config}) ->
  146:     Mods = fetch(modules, App),
  147:     [] = [M || M <- Mods, exports_all(M)];
  148: 
  149: exports(Config) ->
  150:     run(Config, [exports]).
  151: 
  152: exports_all(Mod) ->
  153:     Opts = fetch(options, Mod:module_info(compile)),
  154: 
  155:     is_list(Opts) andalso lists:member(export_all, Opts).
  156: 
  157: %% ===========================================================================
  158: %% # release/1
  159: %%
  160: %% Ensure that it's possible to build a minimal release with our app file.
  161: %% ===========================================================================
  162: 
  163: release({App, Config}) ->
  164:     Rel = {release,
  165:            {"diameter test release", fetch(vsn, App)},
  166:            {erts, erlang:system_info(version)},
  167:            [{A, appvsn(A)} || A <- [sasl | fetch(applications, App)]]},
  168:     Dir = fetch(priv_dir, Config),
  169:     ok = write_file(filename:join([Dir, "diameter_test.rel"]), Rel),
  170:     {ok, _, []} = systools:make_script("diameter_test", [{path, [Dir]},
  171:                                                          {outdir, Dir},
  172:                                                          silent]);
  173: 
  174: release(Config) ->
  175:     run(Config, [release]).
  176: 
  177: %% sasl need to be included to avoid a missing_sasl warning, error
  178: %% in the case of relup/1.
  179: 
  180: appvsn(Name) ->
  181:     [{application, Name, App}] = ?util:consult(Name, app),
  182:     fetch(vsn, App).
  183: 
  184: %% ===========================================================================
  185: %% # xref/1
  186: %%
  187: %% Ensure that no function in our application calls an undefined function
  188: %% or one in an application we haven't declared as a dependency. (Almost.)
  189: %% ===========================================================================
  190: 
  191: xref({App, _Config}) ->
  192:     i("xref -> entry with"
  193:       "~n   App:    ~p"
  194:       "~n   Config: ~p", [App, _Config]),
  195: 
  196:     Mods = fetch(modules, App),  %% modules listed in the app file
  197: 
  198:     %% List of application names extracted from runtime_dependencies.
  199:     i("xref -> get deps"),
  200:     Deps = lists:map(fun unversion/1, fetch(runtime_dependencies, App)),
  201: 
  202:     i("xref -> start xref"),
  203:     {ok, XRef} = xref:start(make_name(xref_test_name)),
  204:     ok = xref:set_default(XRef, [{verbose, false}, {warnings, false}]),
  205: 
  206:     %% Only add our application and those it's dependent on according
  207:     %% to the app file. Well, almost. erts beams are also required to
  208:     %% stop xref from complaining about calls to module erlang, which
  209:     %% was previously in kernel. Erts isn't an application however, in
  210:     %% the sense that there's no .app file, and isn't listed in
  211:     %% applications.
  212:     i("xref -> add own and dep apps"),
  213:     ok = lists:foreach(fun(A) -> add_application(XRef, A) end,
  214:                        [diameter, erts | fetch(applications, App)]),
  215: 
  216:     i("xref -> analyze undefined_function_calls"),
  217:     {ok, Undefs} = xref:analyze(XRef, undefined_function_calls),
  218:     i("xref -> analyze module use: "
  219:       "~n   For mods: ~p", [Mods]),
  220:     {ok, RTmods} = xref:analyze(XRef, {module_use, Mods}),
  221:     i("xref -> analyze (compiler) module use: "
  222:       "~n   For mods: ~p", [?COMPILER_MODULES]),
  223:     {ok, CTmods} = xref:analyze(XRef, {module_use, ?COMPILER_MODULES}),
  224:     i("xref -> analyze module call: "
  225:       "~n   For mods: ~p", [Mods]),
  226:     {ok, RTdeps} = xref:analyze(XRef, {module_call, Mods}),
  227: 
  228:     i("xref -> stop xref"),
  229:     xref:stop(XRef),
  230: 
  231:     i("xref -> get OTP release"),
  232:     Rel = release(),  %% otp_release-ish
  233: 
  234:     %% Only care about calls from our own application.
  235:     i("xref -> Only care about calls from our own application"),
  236:     [] = lists:filter(fun({{F,_,_} = From, {_,_,_} = To}) ->
  237:                               lists:member(F, Mods)
  238:                                   andalso not ignored(From, To, Rel)
  239:                       end,
  240:                       Undefs),
  241: 
  242:     %% Ensure that only runtime or info modules call runtime modules.
  243:     %% It's not strictly necessary that diameter compiler modules not
  244:     %% depend on other diameter modules but it's a simple source of
  245:     %% build errors if not properly encoded in the makefile so guard
  246:     %% against it.
  247:     i("xref -> ensure only runtime and info mod"),
  248:     [] = (RTmods -- Mods) -- ?INFO_MODULES,
  249: 
  250:     %% Ensure that runtime modules don't call compiler modules.
  251:     i("xref -> ensure runtime mods don't call compiler mods"),
  252:     CTmods = CTmods -- Mods,
  253: 
  254:     %% Ensure that runtime modules only call other runtime modules, or
  255:     %% applications declared in runtime_dependencies in the app file.
  256:     %% The declared application versions are ignored since we only
  257:     %% know what we see now.
  258:     i("xref -> ensure runtime mods only call runtime mods"),
  259:     [] = lists:filter(fun(M) -> not lists:member(app(M), Deps) end,
  260:                       RTdeps -- Mods),
  261: 
  262:     i("xref -> done"),
  263:     ok;
  264: 
  265: xref(Config) ->
  266:     i("xref -> entry with"
  267:       "~n   Config: ~p", [Config]),
  268:     Res = run(Config, [xref]),
  269:     i("xref -> done when"
  270:       "~n   Res: ~p", [Res]),
  271:     Res.
  272: 
  273: ignored({FromMod,_,_}, {ToMod,_,_} = To, Rel)->
  274:     %% diameter_tcp does call ssl despite the latter not being listed
  275:     %% as a dependency in the app file since ssl is only required for
  276:     %% TLS security: it's up to a client who wants TLS to start ssl.
  277:     %% The OTP 18 time api is also called if it exists, so that the
  278:     %% same code can be run on older releases.
  279:     {FromMod, ToMod} == {diameter_tcp, ssl}
  280:         orelse (FromMod == diameter_lib
  281:                 andalso Rel < 18
  282:                 andalso lists:member(To, time_api())).
  283: 
  284: %% New time api in OTP 18.
  285: time_api() ->
  286:     [{erlang, F, A} || {F,A} <- [{convert_time_unit,3},
  287:                                  {monotonic_time,0},
  288:                                  {monotonic_time,1},
  289:                                  {system_time,0},
  290:                                  {system_time,1},
  291:                                  {time_offset,0},
  292:                                  {time_offset,1},
  293:                                  {timestamp,0},
  294:                                  {unique_integer,0},
  295:                                  {unique_integer,1}]]
  296:         ++ [{os, system_time, 0},
  297:             {os, system_time, 1}].
  298: 
  299: release() ->
  300:     Rel = erlang:system_info(otp_release),
  301:     try list_to_integer(Rel) of
  302:         N -> N
  303:     catch
  304:         error:_ ->
  305:             0  %% aka < 17
  306:     end.
  307: 
  308: unversion(App) ->
  309:     {Name, [$-|Vsn]} = lists:splitwith(fun(C) -> C /= $- end, App),
  310:     true = is_app(Name), %% assert
  311:     Vsn = vsn_str(Vsn),  %%
  312:     Name.
  313: 
  314: app('$M_EXPR') -> %% could be anything but assume it's ok
  315:     "erts";
  316: app(Mod) ->
  317:     case code:which(Mod) of
  318:         preloaded ->
  319:             "erts";
  320:         Reason when is_atom(Reason) ->
  321:             error({Reason, Mod});
  322:         Path ->
  323:             %% match to identify an unexpectedly short path
  324:             {_, _, [_,_,_|_] = Split} = {Mod, Path, filename:split(Path)},
  325:             unversion(lists:nth(3, lists:reverse(Split)))
  326:     end.
  327: 
  328: add_application(XRef, App) ->
  329:     {ok, App} = xref:add_application(XRef, code:lib_dir(App), []).
  330: 
  331: make_name(Suf) ->
  332:     list_to_atom("diameter_" ++ atom_to_list(Suf)).
  333: 
  334: %% ===========================================================================
  335: %% # relup/1
  336: %%
  337: %% Ensure that we can generate release upgrade files using our appup file.
  338: %% ===========================================================================
  339: 
  340: relup({App, Config}) ->
  341:     i("relup -> entry with"
  342:       "~n   App:    ~p"
  343:       "~n   Config: ~p", [App, Config]),
  344: 
  345:     [{Vsn, Up, Down}] = ?util:consult(diameter, appup),
  346:     true = is_vsn(Vsn),
  347: 
  348:     i("relup -> "
  349:       "~n   Vsn:  ~p"
  350:       "~n   Up:   ~p"
  351:       "~n   Down: ~p", [Vsn, Up, Down]),
  352: 
  353:     Rel = [{erts, erlang:system_info(version)}
  354:            | [{A, appvsn(A)} || A <- [sasl | fetch(applications, App)]]],
  355: 
  356:     i("relup -> "
  357:       "~n   Rel: ~p", [Rel]),
  358: 
  359:     Dir = fetch(priv_dir, Config),
  360: 
  361:     i("relup -> verify path"
  362:       "~n   Dir: ~p", [Dir]),
  363:     verify_path(Dir),
  364: 
  365:     i("relup -> "
  366:       "~n   Dir: "
  367:       "~n      ~s"
  368:       "~n   File info (dir): "
  369:       "~n      ~s", [Dir, file_info(Dir)]),
  370: 
  371:     Name = write_rel(Dir, Rel, Vsn),
  372:     i("relup -> written"
  373:       "~n   Name: "
  374:       "~n      ~s", [Name]),
  375:     UpFrom = acc_rel(Dir, Rel, Up),
  376:     i("relup -> "
  377:       "~n   UpFrom: ~p", [UpFrom]),
  378:     DownTo = acc_rel(Dir, Rel, Down),
  379:     i("relup -> "
  380:       "~n   DownTo: ~p", [DownTo]),
  381: 
  382:     {[], []} = {UpFrom -- DownTo, DownTo -- UpFrom},
  383:     [[], []] = [S -- sets:to_list(sets:from_list(S))
  384:                 || S <- [UpFrom, DownTo]],
  385: 
  386:     i("relup -> try make relup"),
  387:     {ok, _, _, []} = systools:make_relup(Name, UpFrom, DownTo, [{path, [Dir]},
  388:                                                                 {outdir, Dir},
  389:                                                                 silent]);
  390: 
  391: relup(Config) ->
  392:     run(Config, [relup]).
  393: 
  394: 
  395: verify_path(Path) ->
  396:     Components = filename:split(filename:absname(Path)),
  397:     do_verify_path(Components).
  398: 
  399: do_verify_path([]) ->
  400:     exit(not_a_path);
  401: do_verify_path([Root|Components]) ->
  402:     do_verify_path(Root, Components).
  403: 
  404: do_verify_path(Path, []) ->
  405:     case file:read_file_info(Path) of
  406:         {ok, #file_info{type   = directory,
  407:                         access = Access}} ->
  408:             i("do_verify_path -> (final) directory ok:"
  409:               "~n   Path:   ~p"
  410:               "~n   Access: ~p", [Path, Access]),
  411:             ok;
  412:         {ok, #file_info{type   = Type,
  413:                         access = Access}} ->
  414:             i("do_verify_path -> (final) unexpected type: "
  415:               "~n   Path:   ~p"
  416:               "~n   Type:   ~p"
  417:               "~n   Access: ~p", [Path, Type, Access]),
  418:             exit({not_dir, Path, Type, Access});
  419:         {error, Reason} ->
  420:             i("do_verify_path -> failed reading file info: "
  421:               "~n   Path:   ~p"
  422:               "~n   Reason: ~p", [Path, Reason]),
  423:             exit({read_file_info, Path, Reason})
  424:     end;
  425: do_verify_path(Path, [Component|Components]) ->
  426:     case file:read_file_info(Path) of
  427:         {ok, #file_info{type   = directory,
  428:                         access = Access}} ->
  429:             i("do_verify_path -> directory ok: "
  430:               "~n   Path:   ~p"
  431:               "~n   Access: ~p", [Path, Access]),
  432:             do_verify_path(filename:absname_join(Path, Component),
  433:                            Components);
  434:         {ok, #file_info{type   = Type,
  435:                         access = Access}} ->
  436:             i("do_verify_path -> unexpected type: "
  437:               "~n   Path:   ~p"
  438:               "~n   Type:   ~p"
  439:               "~n   Access: ~p", [Path, Type, Access]),
  440:             exit({not_dir, Path, Type, Access});
  441:         {error, Reason} ->
  442:             i("do_verify_path -> failed reading file info: "
  443:               "~n   Path:   ~p"
  444:               "~n   Reason: ~p", [Path, Reason]),
  445:             exit({read_file_info, Path, Reason})
  446:     end.
  447:             
  448: 
  449: file_info(Path) ->
  450:     case file:read_file_info(Path) of
  451:         {ok, Info} ->
  452:             f("~p", [Info]);
  453:         {error, Reason} ->
  454:             f("error: ~p", [Reason])
  455:     end.
  456: 
  457: f(F, A) ->
  458:     lists:flatten(io_lib:format(F, A)).
  459: 
  460: acc_rel(Dir, Rel, List) ->
  461:     lists:map(fun({V,_}) -> write_rel(Dir, Rel, V) end, List).
  462: 
  463: %% Write a rel file and return its name.
  464: write_rel(Dir, [Erts | Apps], Vsn) ->
  465:     VS   = vsn_str(Vsn),
  466:     Name = "diameter_test_" ++ VS,
  467:     File = filename:join([Dir, Name ++ ".rel"]),
  468:     i("write_rel -> attempt write rel file:"
  469:       "~n   Dir:  ~p"
  470:       "~n   File: ~p"
  471:       "~n   File name length: ~p"
  472:       "~n   Erts: ~p"
  473:       "~n   Apps: ~p"
  474:       "~n   Vsn:  ~p (~p)",
  475:       [Dir, File, length(File), Erts, Apps, Vsn, VS]),
  476:     ok = write_file(File,
  477:                     {release,
  478:                      {"diameter " ++ VS ++ " test release", VS},
  479:                      Erts,
  480:                      Apps}),
  481:     Name.
  482: 
  483: 
  484: %% ===========================================================================
  485: %% ===========================================================================
  486: 
  487: fetch(Key, List) ->
  488:     {Key, {Key, Val}} = {Key, lists:keyfind(Key, 1, List)}, %% useful badmatch
  489:     Val.
  490: 
  491: write_file(Path, T) ->
  492:     file:write_file(Path, io_lib:format("~p.", [T])).
  493: 
  494: %% Is a version string of the expected form?
  495: is_vsn(V) ->
  496:     V = vsn_str(V),
  497:     true.
  498: 
  499: %% Turn a from/to version in appup to a version string after ensuring
  500: %% that it's valid version number of regexp. In the regexp case, the
  501: %% regexp itself becomes the version string since there's no
  502: %% requirement that a version in appup be anything but a string. The
  503: %% restrictions placed on string-valued version numbers (that they be
  504: %% '.'-separated integers) are our own.
  505: 
  506: vsn_str(S)
  507:   when is_list(S) ->
  508:     {_, match}   = {S, match(S, "^(0|[1-9][0-9]*)(\\.(0|[1-9][0-9]*))*$")},
  509:     {_, nomatch} = {S, match(S, "\\.0\\.0$")},
  510:     S;
  511: 
  512: vsn_str(B)
  513:   when is_binary(B) ->
  514:     {ok, _} = re:compile(B),
  515:     %% Check if its a wildcard version: "1\\.."
  516:     Str = binary_to_list(B),
  517:     case lists:reverse(Str) of
  518:         [$*, $., $., $\\ | Rest] ->
  519:             lists:reverse(Rest);
  520:         _ ->
  521:             Str
  522:     end.
  523: 
  524: match(S, RE) ->
  525:     re:run(S, RE, [{capture, none}]).
  526: 
  527: %% Is an application name of the expected form?
  528: is_app(S)
  529:   when is_list(S) ->
  530:     {_, match} = {S, match(S, "^([a-z]([a-z_]*|[a-zA-Z]*))$")},
  531:     true.
  532: 
  533: 
  534: i(F) ->
  535:     i(F, []).
  536: 
  537: i(F, A) when is_list(F) andalso is_list(A) ->
  538:     io:format(F ++ "~n", A).
